title: Learning Pathway Explorer
description: An interactive visualization for exploring learning pathways through prerequisite dependencies. Mark concepts as known, see which concepts unlock, and trace valid paths to learning goals.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Instructional Design
Learning Graphs
Knowledge Prerequisites
learningObjectives: Identify prerequisite relationships between learning concepts
Explain how mastery of foundational concepts enables advanced learning
Trace valid learning pathways through a knowledge graph
Analyze the structure of a directed acyclic graph (DAG) in educational context

controls.description: Click on nodes to toggle known/unknown status
Right-click or Ctrl+click on nodes to set as learning goal
Reset button to clear all progress

assumptions: Concepts must be learned in valid topological order
12 representative math concepts from Numbers to Graphing
limitations: Simplified representation of actual learning dependencies
Does not account for partial knowledge or learning styles
Fixed set of concepts (not customizable in this version)
